page.title: 01Whitfield Estate
page.content: About one third of the area is covered with woodland, mostly deciduous but with some coniferous plantations, the remainder being mixed agriculture including sheep, beef and dairy cattle and a wide variety of agricultural crops. The area is largely flat but with some gentle slopes. Most of the area is is owned by a large agricultural estate, the Whitfield estate. Much of it is farmed and managed by the owners with some being occupied by tenant farmers. Whitifeld house stands in extesive park land and is approached by several miles of private roads from 3 directions. The population is evenly scattered thoughout the area and includes farmers, farm workers estate and woodland workers, but the majority have employment outside the area, mostly in nearby Hereford.
